title: Geneva Risk Score for Venous Thromboembolism (VTE) Prophylaxis
description: Predicts the need for venous thromboembolism (VTE) prophylaxis in hospitalized medical patients by assessing risk factors to identify patients who would benefit from thromboprophylaxis versus those at low risk who may not require anticoagulation

parameters.name: immobilization
parameters.description: Immobilization for 3 or more days with less than 30 minutes of walking per day

parameters.name: obesity
parameters.description: Obesity with BMI greater than 30 kg/m²

parameters.name: hormonal_therapy
parameters.description: Hormonal therapy (estrogen-containing contraceptives or hormone replacement therapy)

result.name: geneva_vte_score
result.description: Geneva Risk Score for VTE prophylaxis (0-33 points)

ranges.interpretation: No prophylaxis recommended. VTE risk approximately 0.6%. Monitor for changes in clinical status.
Prophylaxis recommended unless contraindicated. VTE risk approximately 3.2%. Consider pharmacological or mechanical prophylaxis.

references: Chopard P, Spirk D, Bounameaux H. Identifying acutely ill medical patients requiring thromboprophylaxis. J Thromb Haemost. 2006;4(4):915-916. doi: 10.1111/j.1538-7836.2006.01818.x.

Nendaz M, Spirk D, Kucher N, et al. Multicentre validation of the Geneva Risk Score for hospitalised medical patients at risk of venous thromboembolism. Explicit ASsessment of Thromboembolic RIsk and Prophylaxis for Medical PATients in SwitzErland (ESTIMATE). Thromb Haemost. 2014;111(3):531-538. doi: 10.1160/TH13-05-0427.

Decousus H, Tapson VF, Bergmann JF, et al. Factors at admission associated with bleeding risk in medical patients: findings from the IMPROVE investigators. Chest. 2011;139(1):69-79. doi: 10.1378/chest.09-3081.
formula: Score = Sum of all risk factors (2 points for major factors: cardiac failure, respiratory failure, recent stroke <3mo, recent MI <4wks, acute infectious disease, acute rheumatic disease, active malignancy, myeloproliferative syndrome, nephrotic syndrome, prior VTE, hypercoagulable state; 1 point for minor factors: immobilization ≥3d, recent travel >6h, age >60y, obesity BMI>30, chronic venous insufficiency, pregnancy, hormonal therapy, dehydration)
notes: Validated in hospitalized medical patients for VTE prophylaxis decision-making
Score ≥3 indicates high risk requiring prophylaxis consideration
Low-risk patients (score <3) may not require pharmacological prophylaxis
Consider contraindications to anticoagulation before starting prophylaxis
Mechanical prophylaxis may be used when pharmacological prophylaxis is contraindicated
Reassess risk daily during hospitalization as clinical status changes
